content: Names of familial relationships in English and French
summary: Main text is a s. xiimed copy of Ivo of Chartres’ Panormia. A contemporary hand adds, above the main text, the English and French equivalents of the names of relationships in a table of the degrees of consanguinity, within which marriage is prohibited in the main text. Ker suggests that the manuscript may be from Cirencester (1957, p. 433)

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (170v) Cusins parenz. Isibba child. Maglingas. Siblingas.

admin: Described by Mary Swan and Owen Roberson with the assistance of Hollie Morgan and George Younge, with reference to published scholarship; ed. by Takako Kato (2010; 2013).
